result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas E Fisher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:32 AM Defendant Thomas E Fisher in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nathan M Cockerham in court for Thomas E Fisher. Court reviews State filed a sentencing memorandum that has been reviewed. Right before to Court, Attorney Cockerham filed a memorandum that Court now reviews. State recites agreement that in 22CF5, defendant to plead to Counts 1, 5 and 8. Counts 2,3,4,6 and 7 to be dismissed but read in. In 22CF207, defendant to plead to Count 2. Count 1 to be dismissed but read in. State recommends a withheld sentence for 5 years probation with 6 months conditional jail and conditions as outlined in sentencing memo. State has complied with Victim's Rights. Attorney Cockerham notes restitution hearing to be scheduled. Defendant pleads no contest in 22CF5 to Counts 1, 5 and 8 and in 22CF207 Count 2. Attorney Cockerham stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. Court sets restitution hearing on both cases. Attorney Cockerham in agreement for term of probation as stated by the State. Asks for a time served sentence. Would like a small fine and court costs based on age and income of defendant. Court reviews factors in determining sentence. 

Court imposes in 22CF5, for Count 1, withheld sentence for 5 years probation. Concurrent to 22CF207 and remaining counts. Conditions of probation include payment of mandatory court costs, comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC, 6 months jail imposed and stayed for 1 year jail. Defendant to serve 6 months conditional jail with credit for 90 days. Could serve additional time if restitution payments are not being made. Concurrent conditions to 22CF207 and other counts. For count 5, withheld sentence for 5 years probation. Concurrent to 22CF207 and remaining counts. Conditions of probation include comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC, 6 months jail imposed and stayed for 1 year jail. Defendant to serve 6 months conditional jail with credit for 90 days. Could serve additional time if restitution payments are not being made. Concurrent conditions to 22CF207 and other counts. For count 8, withheld sentence for 5 years probation. Concurrent to 22CF207 and remaining counts. Conditions of probation include comply with all programming as deemed necessary by the DOC, 6 months jail imposed and stayed for 1 year jail. Defendant to serve 6 months conditional jail with credit for 90 days. Could serve additional time if restitution payments are not being made. Concurrent conditions to 22CF207 and other counts. In 22CF207 for count 2, withheld sentence for 1 year probation. Concurrent to 22CF5. Conditions of probation include payment of mandatory court costs, 6 months jail with credit for 90 days, concurrent conditions to 22CF5.
Restitution hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Sentencing Memorandum from Attorney Cockerham
State's Sentencing Memorandum
Letter from victim

9:01 AM Defendant Thomas E Fisher in court, in custody.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nathan M Cockerham in court for Thomas E Fisher. Court calls case. Acknowledges receipt, waives reading, enters pleas of not guilty. Court accepts pleas.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:30 am.

8:40 AM Attorney Angela Wilson for Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Nathan M Cockerham in court for Thomas E Fisher. Defendant Thomas E Fisher not in Court. Court reviews defendant was recently arrested on new charges this am. Court resets arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Arraignment on June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: 09:59 AM Defendant Thomas E Fisher in court with attorney Nathan M Cockerham.  Peter Kruger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment.  Court reminds of bail/conditions.  Arraignment scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Letter to Court Commissioner from Attorney Cockerham
Text message reminder - not opting in - no phone

01:35 PM Defendant Thomas E Fisher in court with attorney Lucas A Wyshnytzky.  Defendant Thomas E Fisher in custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Thomas E Fisher appeared by video means with Attorney.  Court quashes warrant, questions non appearance February 2, 2022. Atty asserts defendant was in the hospital and was released on Monday. Defendant was brought into custody last night and asks for signature bond to be reinstated.   State does remember at the Preliminary hearing that Atty Crockerham did mention defendant's medical concerns. State is not opposed to the resetting of Prelim and reinstating the signature bond with conditions remaining the same. 
Time limits have been previously waived. Atty is requesting the 23rd of February or later for resetting Preliminary Hearing. State has no objections to Counsel's request.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 09:15 am.

09:12 AM Attorney Nathan M Cockerham in court. Defendant not in court.  Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney Cockerham indicates that client is in the hospital very ill. Cash bond was converted to signature bond to address health issues that were occuring in jail.  Made voluntary appearance at intial appearance..  Requests that defendant be able to report to the court when he is able to.
State-does not dispute the facts that have been put forward; does not believe he is missing court intentionally. Requests STC or hearing.
Court does not forfeit bail.  Defendant can appear when he is able to do that.  
Court issues warrant based on non appearance.
Letter to Court Commissioner from Attorney Cockerham
Defendant's Demand for Discovery & Inspection

records.addlTxt: 03:43 PM Defendant Thomas E Fisher in court, in custody.  Anne Terrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court inquires if defendant has an attorney. Defendant indicates he does not have an attorney. He also indicates he doesn't know how to apply for a public defendant. Atty Hoffman indicates that Defendant does not quailfy for public defender. Defendant has not had a chance to get an attorney as he doesn't have money. Defendant requests to forgo hearings and just set trial. Court indicates that she is not able to do that. Defendant will proceed as is.
No Contact with victim 1 and victim 2 listed in ID Key, no contact with Poplar Golf Course and from Longshoreman Union Bldg. in Superior, WI

01:29 PM Defendant Thomas E Fisher in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Thomas E Fisher in custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant's address updated. Court will amend the Complaint to show 1905 Ogden Ave, Superior, WI. Attorney asserts that Defendant's middle name is Edward.   Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading.   States request on bail: $5000 cash bond with conditions of No contact with victim 1 and victim 2 as listed in ID Key; Stay away from Poplar Golf Course, Longshoreman Union Bldg. located at 424 Tower Ave., Superior, WI. Atty. Hoffman asserts  Defendant has Family and local ties. 
Court Orders $2500 cash bail with conditions of no contact with victims 1 & 2 as listed in the ID Key; stay away from Poplar Golf Course and Longshoreman Union Bldg. 
Atty Hoffman indicates Defendant does not quailfy. Defendant waive time limits.
Court acknowledges defendant waives time limits voluntairly. Court sets Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 26, 2022 at 09:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for January 24, 2022 at 03:00 pm for Atty. Check.
